subject: Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race (Alaska)
lead_paragraph: DeeDee Jonrowe beat the front-runner Paul Gebhardt to the checkpoint in Cripple, Alaska, by eight minutes to take the lead in the Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race early Thursday morning. Jonrowe, 54, had passed a musher going the wrong way, but she never expected it to be Gebhardt, 50, who was lost for at least six hours. By midmorning, 10 teams were parked in Cripple, the official halfway point and 609 miles from the finish line in Nome, on Alaska’s western coast.
